body_html:
Running your example with TF 1.3.0 in CPU-only mode:

av = sess.run(word_outputs,feed_dict={line:a})   
bv = sess.run(word_outputs,feed_dict={line:b})   
abv = sess.run(word_outputs,feed_dict={line:ab}) 
np.linalg.norm(av-abv[0])
4.1601669e-07
np.linalg.norm(bv-abv[1]) 
6.3027767e-07

and calculating av twice returns identical values.

when i switch everything to float64s, the errors go to zero.

i'll look into it more carefully.

body:
Running your example with TF 1.3.0 in CPU-only mode:
```
av = sess.run(word_outputs,feed_dict={line:a})   
bv = sess.run(word_outputs,feed_dict={line:b})   
abv = sess.run(word_outputs,feed_dict={line:ab}) 
np.linalg.norm(av-abv[0])
4.1601669e-07
np.linalg.norm(bv-abv[1]) 
6.3027767e-07
```
and calculating av twice returns identical values.

when i switch everything to float64s, the errors go to zero.

i'll look into it more carefully.
